newsitem.title: USA: Ford recalls 87,485 cars for steering repair.
newsitem.headline: Ford recalls 87,485 cars for steering repair.

text.p: Ford Motor Co said on Friday it was recalling about 86,485 Crown Victoria and Lincoln Town Car vehicles to correct a problem that could cause a loss of steering control.
The recall affects 1995 and 1996 Crown Victoria Police Interceptor and commercial fleet models and Lincoln Town Car models with the Limousine Conversion or Livery Package.

Ford said the vehicles' pitman arm bearing, a part of the steering mechanism, was not fully lubricated during the manufacturing process and, under hard driving usage, could become excessively worn and fail. If such a failure were to occur, the driver would likely experience a loss of steering control.
Ford said it was aware of no accidents or injuries related to the problem.
Owners are being notified by mail and requested to contact their dealers for inspection, lubrication and, if necessary, replacement of the pitman arm assembly, free of charge.
The service should take about one hour, Ford said.
About 2,787 of the cars being recalled are located in Canada.
